Uses of Class
android.content.ContextWrapper

Packages that use ContextWrapper
android.app High-level classes encapsulating the overall Android application model. 
android.content Contains classes for accessing and publishing data on the device. 
android.inputmethodservice Base classes for writing input methods. 
android.preference Provides classes that manage application preferences and implement the preferences UI. 
android.test A framework for writing Android test cases and suites. 
android.test.mock Utility classes providing stubs or mocks of various Android framework building blocks. 
android.view Provides classes that expose basic user interface classes that handle screen layout and interaction with the user. 
 

Uses of ContextWrapper in android.app
 

Subclasses of ContextWrapper in android.app
 class Activity
          An activity is a single, focused thing that the user can do.
 class ActivityGroup
          A screen that contains and runs multiple embedded activities.
 class AliasActivity
          Stub activity that launches another activity (and then finishes itself) based on information in its component's manifest meta-data.
 class Application
          Base class for those who need to maintain global application state.
 class ExpandableListActivity
          An activity that displays an expandable list of items by binding to a data source implementing the ExpandableListAdapter, and exposes event handlers when the user selects an item.
 class LauncherActivity
          Displays a list of all activities which can be performed for a given intent.
 class ListActivity
          An activity that displays a list of items by binding to a data source such as an array or Cursor, and exposes event handlers when the user selects an item.
(package private)  class ReceiverRestrictedContext
           
 class Service
          A Service is an application component that runs in the background, not interacting with the user, for an indefinite period of time.
 class TabActivity
          An activity that contains and runs multiple embedded activities or views.
 

Uses of ContextWrapper in android.content
 

Subclasses of ContextWrapper in android.content
 class MutableContextWrapper
          Special version of ContextWrapper that allows the base context to be modified after it is initially set.
 

Uses of ContextWrapper in android.inputmethodservice
 

Subclasses of ContextWrapper in android.inputmethodservice
 class AbstractInputMethodService
          AbstractInputMethodService provides a abstract base class for input methods.
 class InputMethodService
          InputMethodService provides a standard implementation of an InputMethod, which final implementations can derive from and customize.
 

Uses of ContextWrapper in android.preference
 

Subclasses of ContextWrapper in android.preference
 class PreferenceActivity
          Shows a hierarchy of Preference objects as lists, possibly spanning multiple screens.
 

Uses of ContextWrapper in android.test
 

Subclasses of ContextWrapper in android.test
 class IsolatedContext
          A mock context which prevents its users from talking to the rest of the device while stubbing enough methods to satify code that tries to talk to other packages.
 class RenamingDelegatingContext
          This is a class which delegates to the given context, but performs database and file operations with a renamed database/file name (prefixes default names with a given prefix).
 class TestBrowserActivity
           
 class TestListActivity
          Activity base class to use to implement your application's tests.
 

Uses of ContextWrapper in android.test.mock
 

Subclasses of ContextWrapper in android.test.mock
 class MockApplication
          A mock Application class.
 

Uses of ContextWrapper in android.view
 

Subclasses of ContextWrapper in android.view
 class ContextThemeWrapper
          A ContextWrapper that allows you to modify the theme from what is in the wrapped context.
